content.description: Lots of nice dike shaped holds some slopers and crips to the top.
content.location: Park at the lodge walk across the street up the hill and look to your left. It’s the largest slab in the mess of little boulders.

content.description: Sit start and go strait up using pocket or crack or go out left on the crimp rail.
content.location: From the lodge pub walk across the street up the hill and look left. Boulder is just past the whale shark slabs.

content.description: Sit start as for Sea Urchin, go straight up through pocket and right-facing slot, topping out directly above the start and avoiding moving out left as Sea Urchin does.
content.location: On the Sea Urchin Boulder, 20-30' left of the Whale Shark Boulder if you are looking at the slab.

content.description: Sit start matched on edge, as for Sea Urchin, go up left hand to the pocket and then the right hand goes around the corner to one of several edges, bump right a little further out until you can find a positive crimp, get your feet up on the left and then bring your left hand into the arete. From here you can either bump the right hand up or cross left to a jug up at the lip, bring your feet around, and mantle up to the right of the tree.
content.location: On the Sea Urchin boulder, 20'-30' left of the Whale Shark Boulder. This Problem starts as for Sea Urchin but trends right under the tree and topping out on the back side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start, matched, on the left facing diagonal edge, step on and go straight up the well featured slab, littered with different crimp & edge options to an easy topout directly above the start.
content.location: Left side of the Whale Shark boulder,

content.description: Stand start on the slab ~8'-10' left of Cling the FIn in crack, trend up and follow the crack to the right, topping out just left of where Cling the Fin finishes. Optional early exit out left when the crack angles out to the right, perhaps a shade easier than the full line.
content.location: On the left side of the Whale Shark Slab.

content.description: Under cling the start and go strait up the slab. The crux is getting out of the undercling. Easy from there.
Featuring a high slab and a couple low ball boulder problems.
